Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 05:03AM rosemary-b wrote: It is frustrating. I am over four years out from chemo and still randomly forget words. Imagine having a new boss and having to pause in the middle of a snetence and finally saying "the thing". I'm sure he was not impressed. I did crosswords during chemo to help my word recall but I don't know that it helped a whole lot. It is easier for me to multitask and organize my thoughts so I guess I just have to give it more time.

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 10:57AM rosemary-b wrote: I must be very lucky. The cancer center at my local hospital had a nutritionist who checked in with me four or five times while I was having chemo, a chaplian who was there every day, and a massage therapist on staff who gave free massages.
